intro: Oxyanthus strigosus, commonly known as the hairy oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Oxyanthus strigosus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
